class.name: RayCast
class.brief_description: Query the closest object intersecting a ray.
class.description: A RayCast represents a line from its origin to its destination position, [code]cast_to[/code]. It is used to query the 3D space in order to find the closest object along the path of the ray. RayCast can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], by setting proper filtering with collision layers, or by filtering object types with type masks. RayCast can be configured to report collisions with [Area]s ([member collide_with_areas]) and/or [PhysicsBody]s ([member collide_with_bodies]). Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions. RayCast calculates intersection every physics frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between physics frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

method.name: add_exception
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified node.

method.name: add_exception_rid
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified [RID].

method.name: clear_exceptions
method.description: Removes all collision exceptions for this ray.

method.name: force_raycast_update
method.description: Updates the collision information for the ray. Use this method to update the collision information immediately instead of waiting for the next [code]_physics_process[/code] call, for example if the ray or its parent has changed state. Note: [code]enabled == true[/code] is not required for this to work.

method.name: get_collider
method.description: Return the first object that the ray intersects, or [code]null[/code] if no object is intersecting the ray (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

method.name: get_collider_shape
method.description: Returns the shape ID of the first object that the ray intersects, or [code]0[/code] if no object is intersecting the ray (i.e. [method is_colliding] returns [code]false[/code]).

method.name: get_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the bit index passed is turned on. Note that bit indexes range from 0-19.

method.name: get_collision_normal
method.description: Returns the normal of the intersecting object's shape at the collision point.

method.name: get_collision_point
method.description: Returns the collision point at which the ray intersects the closest object. Note: this point is in the [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

method.name: is_colliding
method.description: Return whether any object is intersecting with the ray's vector (considering the vector length).

method.name: remove_exception
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified node.

method.name: remove_exception_rid
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified [RID].

method.name: set_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Sets the bit index passed to the [code]value[/code] passed. Note that bit indexes range from 0-19.

members.member: The ray's destination point, relative to the RayCast's [code]position[/code].
If [code]true[/code], collision with [Area]s will be reported. Default value: [code]false[/code].
If [code]true[/code], collision with [PhysicsBody]s will be reported. Default value: [code]true[/code].
The ray's collision mask. Only objects in at least one collision layer enabled in the mask will be detected.
If [code]true[/code] collisions will be reported. Default value: [code]false[/code].
If [code]true[/code] collisions will be ignored for this RayCast's immediate parent. Default value: [code]true[/code].
